P.title: Will we detect a message originating from Luyten's Star before 2046?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as positive if a signal of unambiguously intelligent and extraterrestrial origin originating from Luyten's Star is detected on or near Earth on or before December 31, 2045

Here you can be as detailed as you want mentioning the reasoning of your predictions as well as how / why each prediction obeys the given consistency rules.  For each prediction you are welcome to be as verbose as you want. If there are multiple questions P, Q, you can also make comments on their independence or relationship with each other.

PROB: Output your probability estimates of each of the variables (P, Q, not_P etc).  Here, ONLY output the labels and its associated predictions and NOTHING ELSE. Your output MUST look like and be formatted like the following.
    P: 0.xx
    not_P: 0.xx
    P_or_Q: 0.xx
    ...

CHECK: Go through each rule in CONSISTENCY RULES and check whether each rule is obeyed with your given predictions.  For each rule, first print out the mathematical rule and the associated numbers associated with it.  Then think VERY carefully about whether the outputs obey the mathematical rule. Then output whether it obeys the rule. Your output MUST look like and be formatted like the following.
    neg: P = 1- not_P, EQUATION is EVALUATION
    andor: P = P_or_Q + P_and_Q - Q, EQUATION is EVALUATION
    and:  max(P + Q - 1, 0) <= P_and_Q <= min(P, Q), EQUATION is EVALUATION
    ...
    {ALL consistency checks passed!} OR {failed_check_1, failed_check_2 ... consistency checks failed!}

PROB: Now again output your probability estimates of each variable in a dict like format like before, but taking account and correcting any consistency violations that occured before.
        Note that changing the probability of one given variable for one consistency check will also affect consistency rules for others.  It is IMPERATIVE that all changes  
        your correction needs to ENSURE that it still passes other consistency checks too.
        If there were no violations found then simply output the same dict again.  Your output MUST look like and be formatted like the following.
        P: 0.xx
        not_P: 0.xx
        P_or_Q: 0.xx
        ...
FLOAT: Now just output your probability estimate of P and nothing else as a decimal!

In estimating the probabilities for the given questions, I considered the political landscape, historical trends, and potential outcomes that could influence the events in question. Here’s a breakdown of my reasoning for each variable:

1. **P**: The probability that a member of the Trump family will be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024 is influenced by Donald Trump's popularity within the Republican Party, the potential candidacy of his children, and the political climate leading up to the election. Given the current political dynamics, I estimate this probability at **0.60**.

2. **not_P**: This is the complementary probability that no member of the Trump family will be the nominee. Since I estimated P at 0.60, I calculate not_P as **0.40** (1 - 0.60).

3. **para_P**: This question assesses the possibility of a Trump family member securing the nomination. This is essentially the same as P, so I also set this at **0.60**.

4. **Q**: The probability of armed conflicts between the US and China leading to at least 100 deaths is complex and influenced by geopolitical tensions, military engagements, and historical incidents. Given the current international relations, I estimate this probability at **0.25**.

5. **P_and_Q**: This represents the probability that both events occur: a Trump family member is the nominee and there are significant armed conflicts. Assuming some independence between these events, I estimate this at **0.15**.

6. **P_or_Q**: This is the probability that either event occurs. Using the formula P_or_Q = P + Q - P_and_Q, I calculate this as **0.60 + 0.25 - 0.15 = 0.70**.

7. **Q_and_not_P**: This represents the scenario where there are armed conflicts but no Trump family member is the nominee. I estimate this at **0.10**, considering that if conflicts arise, they might occur regardless of the political nomination.

8. **Q_given_P**: Given that a Trump family member is the nominee, the probability of armed conflicts leading to at least 100 deaths may increase slightly due to heightened tensions. I estimate this at **0.30**.

Overall, my estimates are derived from a combination of current events, historical context, and potential future developments. I will ensure that these estimates comply with the consistency rules provided.

not_P: 0.40
para_P: 0.60
Q: 0.25
P_and_Q: 0.15
P_or_Q: 0.70
Q_and_not_P: 0.10
Q_given_P: 0.30

or: max(P, Q) <= P_or_Q <= min(1, P + Q), max(0.60, 0.25) <= 0.70 <= min(1, 0.60 + 0.25) is TRUE
but: P = P_or_Q - Q_and_not_P, 0.60 = 0.70 - 0.10 is TRUE
cond: P ≈ P_and_Q / Q_given_P, 0.60 ≈ 0.15 / 0.30 is FALSE
para: P = para_P, 0.60 = 0.60 is TRUE

Q.title: Will gravitational waves from the merger of supermassive black holes be detected by November 30, 2027?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as positive if by November 30, 2027, a peer-reviewed publication announces the results of such an event. Statistical significance should be at the 4-sigma or equivalent level.
*(edit 1/1017) November 30 is now a publication date rather than data cutoff date.

I estimate a moderate probability for this event, considering Donald Trump has a strong influence and presence in the Republican party, and there are several family members who may run or be considered. However, the political landscape is unpredictable, so I would assign a probability of around 0.60 to this event.  

### not_P: Will no member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?  
This is the complementary event to P. Given the estimated probability for P, the probability of not_P would be 1 - 0.60 = 0.40.  

### para_P: Is it possible that a Trump family member will secure the Republican nomination for the US Presidency in 2024?  
This question essentially reflects the same situation as P but is framed in a way that suggests a possibility rather than a certainty. Since the probability of P is 0.60, it makes sense to assign the same value to para_P, as it is asking if it is possible.  

### Q: Will armed conflicts between the United States and the People's Republic of China lead to at least 100 deaths before 2050?  
Given the current geopolitical tensions, I would assign a moderate probability of 0.30 to this event. While tensions are high, the actual occurrence of such conflicts leading to significant casualties is uncertain.  

### P_and_Q: Will both of the following occur: (1) A member of the Trump family is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024 (2) Armed conflicts between the United States and China lead to at least 100 deaths before 2050?  
The probability of both events occurring together would depend on the independence of P and Q. Since they are largely independent, I would calculate this as P * Q = 0.60 * 0.30 = 0.18.  

### P_or_Q: Will either of the following occur: (a) A member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024? (b) Armed conflicts between the US and China lead to at least 100 deaths before 2050?  
Using the formula for the probability of either event occurring, P_or_Q = P + Q - P_and_Q = 0.60 + 0.30 - 0.18 = 0.72.  

### Q_and_not_P: Will both of the following occur: (1) Armed conflicts between the United States and China lead to at least 100 deaths before 2050, and (2) no member of the Trump family is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?  
This probability would be calculated as Q * not_P = 0.30 * 0.40 = 0.12.  

### Q_given_P: Given that a member of the Trump family is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024, will armed conflicts between the US and China lead to at least 100 deaths before 2050?  
This is a conditional probability, and while it may not directly affect the probability of Q, I would estimate it to be similar to Q, so I would assign a probability of around 0.30.  

### Summary of Relationships and Independence:  
- P and Q are largely independent events, which allows for straightforward multiplication and addition of probabilities.  
- The complementary relationship between P and not_P is straightforward and follows the rule of P + not_P = 1.  

### Conclusion:  
I will now proceed to assign the probabilities based on this reasoning.

### P: Will a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
This prediction is influenced by the current political climate, the popularity of Trump family members, and their potential candidacies. Given Donald Trump's previous presidency and ongoing influence in the Republican party, I estimate a moderate to high probability that a Trump family member could be nominated. 

### not_P: Will no member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
This prediction is inversely related to P. If I believe there is a reasonable chance of a Trump family member being nominated, then the probability of none being nominated should be lower. Thus, this probability is estimated to be lower than P.

### para_P: Is it possible that a Trump family member will secure the Republican nomination for the US Presidency in 2024?
This is a broader question that encompasses the possibility of any Trump family member being nominated. Since this is essentially a restatement of P, I expect this probability to be similar or slightly higher, as it reflects the general possibility without the constraints of a specific individual.

### Q: Will armed conflicts between the United States and the People's Republic of China lead to at least 100 deaths before 2050?
This question is influenced by geopolitical tensions, military engagements, and historical precedents. Given the current state of affairs and potential flashpoints, I estimate a moderate probability that such conflicts could occur, leading to significant casualties over the specified timeframe.

### P_and_Q: Will both occur: (1) A member of the Trump family is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024 and (2) armed conflicts between the US and China lead to at least 100 deaths before 2050?
This combined event requires both P and Q to be true. Given that these events are likely independent, I will calculate this probability as the product of the individual probabilities, assuming a certain level of independence between the political situation and international conflicts.

### P_or_Q: Will either occur: (a) A member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024 or (b) armed conflicts between the US and China lead to at least 100 deaths before 2050?
This is a union of the two events, leading me to expect a higher probability than either individual event. I will calculate this using the formula for the probability of the union of two events.

### Q_and_not_P: Will both occur: (1) Armed conflicts between the US and China lead to at least 100 deaths before 2050, and (2) no member of the Trump family is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
This scenario requires that Q is true while P is false. Given the dependencies and potential correlations between political events and military conflicts, I will estimate this probability with a careful consideration of how these events might influence each other.

### Q_given_P: Given that a member of the Trump family is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024, will armed conflicts between the US and China lead to at least 100 deaths before 2050?
This conditional probability reflects how the nomination of a Trump family member may influence the likelihood of military conflicts. I will estimate this based on historical context and the current geopolitical landscape.

In summary, I will ensure that the probabilities I assign adhere to the consistency rules provided, checking for logical coherence between related events and adjusting as necessary to maintain mathematical integrity.

P_given_not_Q.title: Conditional on no gravitational waves from the merger of supermassive black holes being detected by November 30, 2027, will we detect a message originating from Luyten's Star before 2046?
P_given_not_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria for the condition: This question will resolve as positive if by November 30, 2027, there is no peer-reviewed publication announcing the results of such an event with statistical significance at the 4-sigma or equivalent level.

Resolution Criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve as positive if a signal of unambiguously intelligent and extraterrestrial origin originating from Luyten's Star is detected on or near Earth on or before December 31, 2045.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

For the question regarding the Trump family member being the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024 (P), I estimate a moderate probability of 0.65. This reflects the current political climate, where Donald Trump remains a significant figure, and there is a possibility that other family members could also be contenders. The complementary probability (not_P) is therefore 0.35, indicating a reasonable chance that no Trump family member will be the nominee.

For the para_P question, which asks if it's possible for a Trump family member to secure the nomination, I would assign a similar probability of 0.65, as the possibility remains contingent on the political landscape and family dynamics.

Regarding the question about armed conflicts leading to at least 100 deaths before 2050 (Q), I estimate a lower probability of 0.40. Given the current geopolitical tensions, particularly with China, there is a risk of conflict, but historical data suggests that large-scale military engagements are less frequent.

For the combined events (P_and_Q), I would estimate the probability at 0.25. This reflects the likelihood that both events occur simultaneously, which is a more restrictive condition.

The probability of either event occurring (P_or_Q) would then be higher, around 0.75, as it encompasses a broader scenario where either a Trump family member could be the nominee or significant armed conflict could occur.

The probability of Q and not P (Q_and_not_P) is estimated at 0.15, indicating that it's plausible for armed conflicts to occur without a Trump family member being the nominee.

For the conditional probability (Q_given_P), I would estimate this at 0.45, suggesting that if a Trump family member is indeed the nominee, the likelihood of armed conflict leading to 100 deaths increases slightly due to potential political ramifications.

These estimates should align with the consistency rules provided, ensuring that they appropriately reflect the relationships and dependencies between the variables.

P.title: Will Metaculus, or a licensed derivative, be operated as a public site by a publicly traded company by 2030?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
Some quite successful companies are not publicly traded, such as Cargill, Albertsons and Koch Industries, see Statista's largest private US companies by revenue for further examples.
However, for many companies, "going public" is a major milestone. Going public allows company founders to "cash out" and diversify their portfolios. It also can allow a company to obtain much greater funding than it might from private sources.
Question: Will Metaculus, or a licensed derivative, be operated as a public site by a publicly traded company by 2030?
The obvious case in which this will be true is if the company owning and operating this site, metaculus.com is a publicly traded company. Either Metaculus would go public itself or a portion of the Metaculus company would be purchased by a publicly traded company at a price that would place the company's value as at least $300 million.
I included operation by a publicly traded company as an option here to handle a situation in which a publicly traded company is making substantial commitment to this technology. That should at least involve license payments to Metaculus of at least $300 million in some year that at least half of which come from publicly traded companies.

4. **Q (Armed Conflicts with China)**: Given the historical context and ongoing tensions, I estimate a probability of 0.30 for armed conflicts leading to at least 100 deaths before 2050.

Q.title: Will the research group that is responsible for developing the first AGI be part of a non-profit corporation?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if the AI system that resolves the question Date first AGI is publicly known. was developed by a research group from a non-profit organization.
If the respective AI system is developed under a collaborative effort between two or more different institutions, the question resolves positively for both. For example, if OpenAI and UC Berkeley's CHAI had joined forces for the responsible project, this would count for both for-profit corporation and university.

P_given_Q.title: Conditional on the research group that is responsible for developing the first AGI being part of a non-profit corporation, will Metaculus, or a licensed derivative, be operated as a public site by a publicly traded company by 2030?
P_given_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria for P:
This question will resolve positively if the AI system that resolves the question 'Date first AGI is publicly known' was developed by a research group from a non-profit organization. If the respective AI system is developed under a collaborative effort between two or more different institutions, the question resolves positively for both. For example, if OpenAI and UC Berkeley's CHAI had joined forces for the responsible project, this would count for both for-profit corporation and university.

Resolution Criteria for Q:
Some quite successful companies are not publicly traded, such as Cargill, Albertsons and Koch Industries, see Statista's largest private US companies by revenue for further examples. However, for many companies, "going public" is a major milestone. Going public allows company founders to "cash out" and diversify their portfolios. It also can allow a company to obtain much greater funding than it might from private sources.

Question: Will Metaculus, or a licensed derivative, be operated as a public site by a publicly traded company by 2030? The obvious case in which this will be true is if the company owning and operating this site, metaculus.com is a publicly traded company. Either Metaculus would go public itself or a portion of the Metaculus company would be purchased by a publicly traded company at a price that would place the company's value as at least $300 million. I included operation by a publicly traded company as an option here to handle a situation in which a publicly traded company is making substantial commitment to this technology. That should at least involve license payments to Metaculus of at least $300 million in some year that at least half of which come from publicly traded companies.

Given the significant media attention surrounding the Trump family, I would assign a relatively high probability to P.

The question Q regarding armed conflicts between the US and China leading to at least 100 deaths before 2050 is influenced by geopolitical tensions and historical data on conflicts. I would assign a moderate probability to this event based on current trends and expert analyses. 

For the combined events P_and_Q, I would consider the independent probabilities of P and Q. Since both events need to happen for P_and_Q to be true, I would expect this probability to be lower than either P or Q alone. Conversely, P_or_Q would be higher, as it captures the likelihood of either event occurring. 

The Q_and_not_P question involves an intersection of Q with the negation of P. This would likely have a lower probability since it requires Q to occur while simultaneously excluding the possibility of a Trump family member being the nominee. 

Lastly, Q_given_P examines the scenario where a Trump family member is the nominee and assesses the likelihood of Q occurring under that condition. This probability would depend on the correlation between the two events, which I would evaluate based on current events and historical context.

P.title: Will there be a 4 year interval in which world output doubles before 2050?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
Resolution is by credible assessment of world GDP in constant US dollars (or other appropriately widely-accepted units).
This question will resolve positively if world output doubles in a period of 4 years or less before 2050. It resolves negatively otherwise, i.e. if the following related question resolves ambiguously:
[Will there be a complete 4 year interval in which world output doubles, before the first 1 year interval in which world output doubles?](https://www.metaculus.com/questions/736/will-…

Q.title: Will humanity maintain a continuous off-Earth presence until 2050?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
Since October 31 2000, the date Soyuz TM-31 lifted off from the Baikonur Cosmodrome carrying the members of Expedition 1, the first long-duration ISS crew, humanity has maintained a permanent off-Earth presence for more than 19 years.
This question asks: Will humanity maintain an off-Earth presence continuously until 1 January 2050?
For a positive resolution, at least one living and conscious biological human must be physically located at some point beyond 100km altitude above Earth's mean sea level at all times continuously until 1 January 2050. This could include persons aboard spacecraft and space stations, as well as persons on any astronomical object other than Earth (e.g. Moon or Mars explorers / settlers).
If the number of living and conscious biological humans off-Earth drops to zero at any time before 1 January 2050, this question resolves negatively. EMs, artificial intelligence systems, humans in suspended animation or cryopreservation, and all other instances of either wholly non-biological or non-conscious humans will not count for the purposes of this question. Humans who are merely sleeping will be considered conscious for the purposes of this question.
However, biological humans with some degree of cybernetic augmentation (brain implants, artificial limbs or organs, etc) will suffice, so long as they could still reproduce with un-augmented humans.

P_given_not_Q.title: Conditional on humanity failing to maintain a continuous off-Earth presence until 2050, will there be a 4 year interval in which world output doubles before 2050?
P_given_not_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria for P:
Since October 31 2000, the date Soyuz TM-31 lifted off from the Baikonur Cosmodrome carrying the members of Expedition 1, the first long-duration ISS crew, humanity has maintained a permanent off-Earth presence for more than 19 years.
This question asks: Will humanity fail to maintain an off-Earth presence continuously until 1 January 2050?
For a positive resolution, the number of living and conscious biological humans off-Earth must drop to zero at any time before 1 January 2050. This includes persons aboard spacecraft and space stations, as well as persons on any astronomical object other than Earth (e.g. Moon or Mars explorers / settlers).
If at least one living and conscious biological human is physically located at some point beyond 100km altitude above Earth's mean sea level at all times continuously until 1 January 2050, this question resolves negatively. EMs, artificial intelligence systems, humans in suspended animation or cryopreservation, and all other instances of either wholly non-biological or non-conscious humans will not count for the purposes of this question. Humans who are merely sleeping will be considered conscious for the purposes of this question.
However, biological humans with some degree of cybernetic augmentation (brain implants, artificial limbs or organs, etc) will suffice, so long as they could still reproduce with un-augmented humans.

Resolution Criteria for Q:
Resolution is by credible assessment of world GDP in constant US dollars (or other appropriately widely-accepted units).
This question will resolve positively if world output doubles in a period of 4 years or less before 2050. It resolves negatively otherwise, i.e. if the following related question resolves ambiguously:
[Will there be a complete 4 year interval in which world output doubles, before the first 1 year interval in which world output doubles?](https://www.metaculus.com/questions/736/will-…
